pullRequest.body:
Add `measurableSet_tendsto`: the set of points for which a measurable sequence of functions converges to a given filter is measurable.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: I moved `measurableSet_tendsto` to an earlier file (right after the definition of `IsMeasurablyGenerated`). According to `#find_home!`, the second one should stay in the Polish file (we don't have a measure theory file about metrizable spaces).

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8019780128/job/21908253208)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8019780128/job/21908252708)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8019780128/job/21908253498)

Modulo the small hole described [here](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/HasBasis.2Enhds_interior/near/419277277), you could do:
```suggestion
lemma measurableSet_tendsto_nhds [TopologicalSpace γ] [FirstCountableTopology γ]
    [MeasurableSpace γ] [OpensMeasurableSpace γ] [Countable ι] {l : Filter ι}
    [l.IsCountablyGenerated] {f : ι → β → γ} (hf : ∀ i, Measurable (f i)) (c : γ) :
    MeasurableSet { x | Tendsto (fun n ↦ f n x) l (𝓝 c) } := by
  rcases l.exists_antitone_basis with ⟨u, hu⟩
  rcases (𝓝 c).exists_antitone_basis with ⟨v, hv⟩
  simp only [hu.tendsto_iff hv.toHasBasis.nhds_interior, true_imp_iff, true_and, setOf_forall,
    setOf_exists]
  refine .iInter fun _ ↦ .iUnion fun _ ↦ .biInter (to_countable _) fun i _ ↦
    isOpen_interior.measurableSet.preimage (hf i)
```
Note that the topological hypotheses on `γ` are significantly weaker (in fact, I'm no expert of the file structure in this area of mathlib, but maybe it should be moved out of this file since it no longer mentions polish spaces).

Here's an even better version based on the discussion on Zulip, which allows more general filters on the target!
```suggestion
lemma measurableSet_tendsto [MeasurableSpace γ] [Countable ι] {l : Filter ι} (l' : Filter γ)
    [l.IsCountablyGenerated] [l'.IsCountablyGenerated] [hl' : l'.IsMeasurablyGenerated]
    {f : ι → β → γ} (hf : ∀ i, Measurable (f i)) :
    MeasurableSet { x | Tendsto (fun n ↦ f n x) l l' } := by
  rcases l.exists_antitone_basis with ⟨u, hu⟩
  rcases (Filter.hasBasis_self.mpr hl'.exists_measurable_subset).exists_antitone_subbasis with
    ⟨v, v_meas, hv⟩
  simp only [hu.tendsto_iff hv.toHasBasis, true_imp_iff, true_and, setOf_forall, setOf_exists]
  exact .iInter fun n ↦ .iUnion fun _ ↦ .biInter (to_countable _) fun i _ ↦
    (v_meas n).2.preimage (hf i)
```

Thanks for the suggestion! I've replaced the lemma with your version.
I have added another related result that I will also need, about convergence to a given function. I still need to move the two lemmas to an appropriate place.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add `measurableSet_tendsto_nhds`
